channel.title: Powered Rails
channel.description:
I have powered rails and for some reason they only brake but they are suppose to make them move also.
How do I make them like a boost instead of a brake?

item.title: Powered Rails
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:8, topic:399334”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=496470.msg3629920#msg3629920 date=1308130014]
But for atheistic reasons, I suggest simply digging a hole under the powered track and putting a redstone torch there so it still powers the track but is not visible when looking at the track.
[/quote]I thought powering from below didn’t work for rails[/quote]
Just tried it. There is a catch to the process. The redstone torch needs to be laid down after the rail. Thus, you will need to have a small dugout to re-fil for a little. If you simply dig 2 down, place a torch, place a dirt block then the powered rail it will not work.

Read full topic

item.title: Powered Rails
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Travas, post:4, topic:399334”]Idk if you can just put a redstone torch next to the track itself, but that may work also.[/quote]Yes, that works.

Read full topic

item.title: Powered Rails
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

Connect a trail of redstone to it, and put a redstone torch at the end of the redstone trail. Idk if you can just put a redstone torch next to the track itself, but that may work also.

Read full topic
